user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_uio_dev_bind:
```c
static int metal_uio_dev_bind(struct linux_device *ldev,
			      struct linux_driver *ldrv)
{
	struct sysfs_attribute *attr;
	int result;

	if (strcmp(ldev->sdev->driver_name, ldrv->drv_name) == 0)
		return 0;

	if (strcmp(ldev->sdev->driver_name, SYSFS_UNKNOWN) != 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_INFO, "device %s in use by driver %s\n",
			  ldev->dev_name, ldev->sdev->driver_name);
		return -EBUSY;
	}

	attr = sysfs_get_device_attr(ldev->sdev, "driver_override");
	if (!attr) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "device %s has no override\n",
			  ldev->dev_name);
		return -errno;
	}

	result = sysfs_write_attribute(attr, ldrv->drv_name,
				       strlen(ldrv->drv_name));
	if (result) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "failed to set override on %s\n",
			  ldev->dev_name);
		return -errno;
	}
	ldev->override = attr;

	attr = sysfs_get_driver_attr(ldrv->sdrv, "bind");
	if (!attr) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "driver %s has no bind\n", ldrv->drv_name);
		return -ENOTSUP;
	}

	result = sysfs_write_attribute(attr, ldev->dev_name,
				       strlen(ldev->dev_name));
	if (result) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "failed to bind %s to %s\n",
			  ldev->dev_name, ldrv->drv_name);
		return -errno;
	}

	metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "bound device %s to driver %s\n",
		  ldev->dev_name, ldrv->drv_name);

	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
attr = sysfs_get_driver_attr(ldrv->sdrv, "bind");
if (!attr) {
	metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "driver %s has no bind\n", ldrv->drv_name);
	return -ENOTSUP;
}
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the provided fragment. The null-check on attr is reachable and correctly handles the case where sysfs_get_driver_attr() returns NULL. A possible violation scenario would be if sysfs_get_driver_attr() is provably guaranteed (by implementation or analysis annotations) to never return NULL (for example it always returns a valid pointer or it never returns at all). In that case the if (!attr) branch would be unreachable and would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.
